title: Code Examples for Chapter 1

code_examples.title: Simple ROS 2 Publisher Node
code_examples.section: 1.3.2 Nodes, Topics, and the Pub/Sub Pattern
code_examples.purpose: Demonstrate how to create a ROS 2 publisher node that broadcasts sensor data messages
code_examples.expected_behavior: Node publishes String messages to a topic at 1 Hz (every 1 second)

validation.syntax: Valid Python 3.10+ syntax with type hints
validation.api_compliance: Must use rclpy.node.Node and rclpy.publisher.Publisher from ROS 2 Humble
validation.documentation: Must include docstring and inline comments explaining key concepts

code_examples.expected_output: Messages like 'Publishing: Hello World 1' printed to console, verifiable with 'ros2 topic echo' command

code_examples.title: Simple ROS 2 Subscriber Node
code_examples.section: 1.3.2 Nodes, Topics, and the Pub/Sub Pattern
code_examples.purpose: Demonstrate how to create a ROS 2 subscriber node that receives and processes messages
code_examples.expected_behavior: Node subscribes to topic and logs received messages to console

validation.syntax: Valid Python 3.10+ syntax with type hints
validation.api_compliance: Must use rclpy.node.Node and rclpy.subscription.Subscription from ROS 2 Humble
validation.callback: Must implement callback function for message reception
validation.documentation: Must include docstring and comments explaining subscription and callback patterns

code_examples.expected_output: Messages received from publisher printed to console (e.g., 'Received: Hello World 1')

code_examples.title: ROS 2 Launch File with Multiple Nodes
code_examples.purpose: Demonstrate how to orchestrate publisher and subscriber nodes in a single launch file
code_examples.expected_behavior: Launching this file starts both publisher and subscriber nodes with proper parameter passing

validation.syntax: Valid YAML syntax, compliant with ROS 2 launch format
validation.node_configuration: Both nodes specified with correct package and executable names
validation.parameter_passing: At least one parameter (e.g., topic_name, publish_frequency) configurable via launch file
validation.documentation: Comments explaining launch structure and node relationships

code_examples.expected_output: Both nodes running concurrently; subscriber receives messages from publisher via ROS 2 topic

code_examples.title: 2-Link Robotic Arm URDF Example
code_examples.purpose: Complete worked example of robot structure description in URDF format
code_examples.environment: URDF 1.0 format, compatible with ROS 2 RViz visualization
code_examples.expected_behavior: URDF loads without errors in RViz, renders 2-link arm with joints that can be manipulated

validation.xml_schema: Valid XML with proper URDF element structure
validation.links: Two links defined with visual and collision geometry (e.g., cylinders or boxes)
validation.joints: Two revolute joints with realistic limits (e.g., Â±90 degrees)
validation.coordinate_frames: Proper origin definitions for each link and joint
validation.documentation: Comments explaining each major element: links, joints, origin, inertia (if included)

code_examples.expected_output: RViz successfully loads URDF and displays 2-link arm; joints have motion limits enforced

code_examples.title: URDF Launch File for RViz Visualization
code_examples.purpose: Demonstrate how to launch URDF visualization in RViz with proper coordinate frames
code_examples.expected_behavior: Launch file loads URDF and starts RViz with robot model visible

validation.components: Loads URDF parameter, starts robot_state_publisher and RViz nodes
validation.parameters: URDF file path correctly specified, RViz config included
validation.documentation: Comments explaining each component and their roles

code_examples.expected_output: RViz opens with 2-link arm visible; joint markers can be manipulated to change arm pose

code_validation_strategy.syntax_check: All code must be valid syntax for stated language/version
code_validation_strategy.api_check: Python examples must use rclpy APIs from ROS 2 Humble; URDF must validate against ROS URDF schema
code_validation_strategy.execution_check: Code must run on ROS 2 Humble without runtime errors (documented expected environment)
code_validation_strategy.documentation_check: Each example must include docstrings and inline comments explaining key concepts
code_validation_strategy.learning_alignment: Each example must reinforce specific learning outcome from learning-outcomes.json

note: Code examples are designed to be copy-paste ready for students, with enough detail for learning but simplified to avoid overwhelming complexity. Advanced error handling is mentioned but not implemented in these basic examples.
